overview.short: Abiotrophia defectiva is a fastidious Gram-positive coccus and a member of the nutritionally variant streptococci, requiring enriched media or growth factors for reliable cultivation.
overview.clinical_context: Strongly associated with infective endocarditis and other invasive bloodstream infections.

species_markers.notes: Poor or absent growth on routine Blood Agar without pyridoxal or satellite growth is characteristic.

common_confusions.reason: Closely related nutritionally variant streptococci with overlapping phenotypic profiles.
Similar Gram-positive cocci morphology and catalase-negative reactions.

when_to_question_identification: Failure to grow without enriched media or pyridoxal supplementation.
Blood culture isolate with streptococcus-like morphology but inconsistent biochemical results.
Suspected endocarditis isolate not fitting standard Streptococcus species.

recommended_next_tests.test: Pyridoxal supplementation or satellite growth testing
recommended_next_tests.reason: Confirms nutritionally variant streptococcal growth requirement.
Most reliable method for definitive species-level identification.
Recommended when phenotypic methods are inconclusive.
